title: India vs Sri Lanka 2nd T20I to be played today after Krunal Pandya tests positive
snippet: Covid continues to stump cricket. Just a few hours before it was scheduled to begin, the second T20 International between India and Sri Lanka at the R Premadasa Stadium in Colombo on Tuesday was postponed by 24 hours after India allrounder Krunal Pandya tested positive for Covid-19.

title: Sri Lanka receives largest COVID-19 vaccine donation from China
snippet: Sri Lanka on Tuesday received the largest COVID-19 vaccine donation from China which arrived here on board two chartered Sri Lankan Airlines flights, the Chinese Embassy to Sri Lanka said in a statement.

title: COVID positive Krunal Pandya separated from team, moved to another hotel in Sri Lanka: Report
snippet: India all-rounder Krunal Pandya has been reportedly moved to a different hotel in Sri Lanka. He tested positive for COVID-19 on Tuesday (July 27).

title: Soft bio-bubble in England a concern, admits Aakash Chopra as virus breaches Indian camp in Sri Lanka
snippet: After Krunal Pandya contracted Covid-19, cricketer-turned-pundit Aakash Chopra is concerned about the fate of the India vs England Test series since UK will have a soft bio-bubble.

title: India vs Sri Lanka: 2nd T20I likely to be played; Shaw, Kishan, Surya may miss, contacts of Krunal negative
snippet: The second T20I between India and Sri Lanka could be played on (July 28) as rescheduled. Though a final decision is yet to be made.

title: Sri Lanka's nurses to launch protest-strike during lunch hour over unfulfilled promises
snippet: With hospitals said to be running out of capacity, a government nurses' union in Sri Lanka will be on strike from 12 noon to 1pm Wednesday (28) in 100 hospitals across the island over unfulfilled promises on the part of the government.

title: Cricket: India to take on Sri Lanka in Second T-20 International match in Colombo tonight
snippet: In Colombo, the second T20 International between India and Sri Lanka scheduled to be played last night was postponed by a day after Indian all-rounder Krunal Pandya tested positive for COVID-19. The entire Team India is undergoing RT-PCR tests today to ascertain any further outbreak in the squad.

title: Sri Lanka to receive 4 million doses of Sinopharm vaccine next week
snippet: Sri Lanka is to receive another 4 million doses of the Sinopharm vaccine next week. The Sri Lanka Embassy in Beijing said that arrangements are being made to airfreight the consignment between 04-08 August 2021.

title: Sri Lanka central bank bill stock top trillion rupees after July reserve outflow

title: Sydney adds four weeks to lockdown as Australia COVID-19 cases grow
snippet: Australia’s biggest city, Sydney, extended a lockdown by four weeks on Wednesday after an already protracted stay-at-home order failed to douse a COVID-19 outbreak, with authorities warning of tougher policing to stamp out non-compliance.

title: Harin arrives at CID to record statement
snippet: Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) MP Harin Fernando arrived at the CID to record a statement a short while ago over the Easter Sunday terror attacks.

title: SL to receive another 4mn doses of Sinopharm vaccines from China
snippet: Sri Lanka will receive another four million doses of Sinopharm vaccines, purchased from the Chinese manufacturer in the first week of August, the Sri Lankan Embassy in China said.

title: Colombo-bound container vessel impounded at Ctg port
snippet: A Colombo-bound vessel carrying export containers has been kept impounded at the Chattogram port’s outer anchorage in Bangladesh for the last eight days by Chittagong Port Authority (CPA) following a High Court order.

title: Krunal Pandya out of series with 7-day isolation, all 8 close contacts test negative
snippet: All eight close contacts of Indian all-rounder Krunal Pandya who were isolated after Pandya was tested positive for COVID-19, have tested ’’negative’’ in the RT-PCR tests and will be available for the postponed game which is to be held today.

title: Delta variant more transmissible but not more fatal than others: WHO expert
snippet: An expert of the World Health Organization (WHO) said Delta variant of Covid-19 is more transmissible and results in more hospitalisation, but it is not more fatal than others.

title: Nurses to stage one-hour protest outside 100 main Hospitals today
snippet: While claiming that the authorities have failed to resolve their issues, Government Nursing Officers’ Association President Saman Rathnapriya yesterday said they would stage a protest campaign outside nearly 100 main Hospitals today between 12 p.m. to 1 p.m.

title: Petitions against Finance Bill re-fixed for today
snippet: The Supreme Court yesterday re-fixed for today (28), the hearing into several Special Determination (SD) petitions filed challenging the constitutionality of the Finance Bill.
